channel.title: How to create a Terms of Service for your website
channel.description:
[size=18pt]I am Mastazak on R--- S-----[/size] [B][U]Purpose:[/U][/B] Create a terms of service that users have to agree to before entering your website. [B][U]Difficulty:[/U][/B] 2/10 [size=18pt]Step 1 - [/size] Go into your website files and rename index.html (or index.php) to index1.html (or php) Create a new index.html file and put this inside You need to change some stuff to your own website info. [code] Terms Of Service

Your Server name - Terms Of Service

By clicking 'I Agree' you agree to everything stated below:
  1. You are not an employee of Jagex LTD, or runescape, and are not a family member or acquaintance of the aforementioned.
  2. You are not an employee of any law firm contracted with Jagex LTD, and are not a family member or acquaintance of said firm.
  3. You do not currently play runescape, or any other Jagex game, and are therefore not subject to their TOS or any other agreement with them.
Click 'I Agree' if, and only if, you agree to ALL of the above terms.
You must have cookies enabled for this to work.

I Agree

Cancel

Copyright © 2009 YOURSERVERNAME

[/code] Explanation: What this does is when users go to your site ( EX: moparisthebest.com) Instead of showing the main page, it will show the terms of service (because it's named index.html). When you click "I Agree" it sends you to index1.html, where your website resides :awesome: Credits: Mopar's terms of service (idea and some code) - 90% Me for removing ads, and adding a spot to put your logo/banner, sharing with y'all (h) Hopefully this will deter Jagex a little bit. Also, I know this is not a very good method. If anyone has a better method for this, please post it.

item.title: How to create a Terms of Service for your website
item.dc:creator: @ztornado5 ztornado5
item.description:
@ztornado5 wrote:

[size=18pt]I am Mastazak on R— S-----[/size]

Purpose: Create a terms of service that users have to agree to before entering your website.

Difficulty: 2/10

[size=18pt]Step 1 - [/size]

Go into your website files and rename index.html (or index.php) to index1.html (or php)

Create a new index.html file and put this inside

You need to change some stuff to your own website info.

[code]

Terms Of Service

Your Server name - Terms Of Service

By clicking 'I Agree' you agree to everything stated below:
  1. You are not an employee of Jagex LTD, or runescape, and are not a family member or acquaintance of the aforementioned.
  2. You are not an employee of any law firm contracted with Jagex LTD, and are not a family member or acquaintance of said firm.
  3. You do not currently play runescape, or any other Jagex game, and are therefore not subject to their TOS or any other agreement with them.
Click 'I Agree' if, and only if, you agree to ALL of the above terms.
You must have cookies enabled for this to work.

I Agree

Cancel

Copyright © 2009 YOURSERVERNAME
<img src="http://neverendingrs.no-ip.biz/yanille.jpg"

[/code]

Explanation: What this does is when users go to your site ( EX: moparisthebest.com) Instead of showing the main page, it will show the terms of service (because it’s named index.html). When you click “I Agree” it sends you to index1.html, where your website resides :awesome:

Credits: Mopar’s terms of service (idea and some code) - 90%
Me for removing ads, and adding a spot to put your logo/banner, sharing with y’all (h)

Hopefully this will deter Jagex a little bit. Also, I know this is not a very good method. If anyone has a better method for this, please post it.

Read full topic
item.source: How to create a Terms of Service for your website
